clinical_study.brief_title: Phenylephrine and Hypotension During Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: A Study Evaluating Hypotension and Autonomic Nervous System Dysfunction During Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Section and Its Relation to the Effect of Prophylaxis Phenylephrine

brief_summary.textblock: Pregnant women with a positive preoperative Supine stress test were found to be a subgroup at increased risk of symptomatic hypotension after spinal anesthesia

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will be placed in dorsal decubitus dislocating the uterus to the left for a few minutes, with blood pressure and heart rate recorded three times, with a three-minute interval between measurements to obtain mean baseline levels and this will be repeated in an upright position to record the same measurement.Orthostatic hypotension (Orthostatic hypotension "OH" is defined specifically as a 20mmHg drop in systolic, and/or a 10mmHg drop in diastolic blood pressure within 3 minutes of standing.

primary_outcome.time_frame: within first 24 hours after spinal anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: blood pressure will be measured every 3 minutes within the first 30 minutes after spinal block the every 5 minutes till the end of the caesarian section. postoperatively will be checked every 15 minutes in the first hour the every 30 minutes till the recovery from spinal block

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within first 24 hours after spinal anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: heart rate will be measured every 5 minutes till the end of the caesarian section. postoperatively will be checked every 15 minutes in the first hour the every 30 minutes till the recovery from spinal block

arm_group.description: This group will include patients with orthostatic hypotension and will be managed with routine spinal anesthesia Ephedrine will be used for management of intraoperative hypotension

This group will include patients with orthostatic hypotension and will be managed with prophylaxis single dose of phenylephrine, 50 ug IV, will be administered immediately before the spinal block then the patients will be managed with routine spinal anesthesia Ephedrine will be used for management of intraoperative hypotension

intervention.description: it will be given as a prophylaxis for prevention of hypotension after spinal anesthesia in pregnant patients undergoing cesarean section
5 ml normal saline will be given before spinal anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Physical status ASA I, A full term pregnancy A single fetus Elective cesarean section.
Exclusion Criteria:
Refusal of the patient to participate in the study History of hypertension Pregnancy-induced hypertension Cardiovascular or cerebrovascular disease Fetal abnormalities History of hypersensitivity to the drugs used Contraindications to spinal block.
